test_questions.question: Former Australian captain Mark Taylor has had several nicknames over his playing career. Which of the following was NOT one of them?
test_questions.explanation: He was christened 'Helium Bat' very early in his career by team mates, due to his habit of lifting his bat over his shoulder and letting anything bowled outside the off-stump go by.

test_questions.question: Which was the 1st non Test playing country to beat India in an international match?
test_questions.explanation: Sri Lanka got the status of Test playing country in 1981, and beat India in the 1979 World Cup. Before this they were champion of ICC non-test playing countries.

test_questions.question: Track and field star Carl Lewis won how many gold medals at the 1984 Olympic games?
test_questions.explanation: Lewis has won nine Olympic gold medals in all: four in 1984 (100m, 200m, 4x100m, long jump), two in 1988 (100m and long jump), two in 1992 (4x100m and long jump), and one in 1996 (long jump).

test_questions.question: When was Amateur Athletics Federation of India established?
test_questions.explanation: Amateur Athletic Federation of India (AAFI) was formed in 1946 at the initiative of Maharaja Yadvindra Singh, the then President of Indian Olympic Association with Prof. G.D. Sondhi as its first President.

test_questions.question: Who did Stone Cold Steve Austin wrestle at the 1998 edition of "Over the Edge"?
test_questions.explanation: Even though Mick Foley portrayed all of these gimmicks, he wrestled Stone Cold under Dude Love. The match had Vince McMahon as the referee. It started off as a regular match. Vince then changed it to No Holds Barred so Dude Love can use weapons. Finally he changed it to Falls Count Anywhere. That happened when Love had Austin knocked out while outside the ring. Since Vince is the owner and assigned himself as referee he could do what he wants. After all of that, Austin still retained his title that night.

test_questions.question: What do African-American football players Ernie Davis, Archie Griffin, and Tony Dorsett have in common?
test_questions.optb: They all won the Heisman Trophy
test_questions.optc: They all led to Super Bowl titles
test_questions.explanation: Ernie Davis was the first African American to win the prize in 1961, and Archie Griffin is the only player to have won it twice, in 1974 and 1975. Only Dorsett played for Pittsburgh. Davis played for Syracuse and Griffin played for Ohio State. Only Dorsett did lead his team to a Super Bowl title as NFC Rookie of the Year in 1977-78.

test_questions.question: Which cricketer died on the field in Bangladesh while playing for Abahani Club?
test_questions.explanation: Raman Lamba, Rambo to friends, had played for India in four Tests and 32 one-day internationals. While fielding, he was felled at silly mid-on by a shot from national player Mehrab Hussain Opee's willow. Lamba was admitted to a private clinic and later to the Dhaka Medical College. From there he was shifted to the postgraduate hospital where he died.

test_questions.question: With which sport is the 'Choudhury Trophy' associated?
test_questions.optb: Circumnavigation of the earth by car
test_questions.explanation: Circumnavigating of the earth by car. This trophy has been named after Saloo and Neena Choudhury, ace car rallyists from Calcutta. It's in recognition of the couple's achievement in 1989 when they passed through all six continents in 69 days and repeated the same feat in 1991 in 39 days.
